extendedInfo.description: This application easily and quickly enables WiFi Tethering hotspot AP in 1-Click. The connection speed is accelerated.Use it to get Internet connection on Windows, Mac, another Android phone or tablet, Ubuntu, Wii, xBox live, PS3 and a lot more, everywhere. One of our users use it in the woods and dance with xBox live! What a wonderful portable party!You can customize your personal hotspot name and set the password to enhance security.Perhaps the world's lightest, cleanest and fastest app for launching WiFi hotspot. We have reduced the app size to almost nothing.It does NOT require root access.How to use it? Just click the application to start tethering. That's all.Important: If this works on your unrooted device, please don't accept system updates, otherwise there is a risk that this application will be banned and will not be compatible with your new system any more. The only solution then should be to root your beloved phone. Please read carefully before commenting. What this application does is exactly the same as what can be manually done as described here on the official Google help page:http://www.google.com/support/mobile/bin/answer.py?answer=168932This application works just as a quick WiFi hotspot launcher.Its purpose is to avoid and replace the standard manual configuration, which requires at least 5 clicks everytime you need to start WiFi tethering, which might also ask you to enter some text to configure the WiFi hotspot.If you use this application, you only need one click without entering anything, unless for the first time you might want to change the WiFi hotspot name and set your password for a secured connection.We have tested it mainly with European carriers. It works on most devices with Android 2.2 or higher.We cannot garantee that your external device will finally get Internet connection from your phone, because it is really carrier or device specific. Please do not give it a bad rate if it doesn't work. Thanks:)If you are unable to open an Internet connection, there are several possible reasons:1. Your operator doesn't support WiFi tethering and blocks it on purpose.2. Your phone's 3G connection is too weak.3. Your system ROM had been modified by the manufacturer4. You don't have a data plan on your SIM cardThere is a special and rare case for some phones. Sometimes even though it seems that the Internet does not work at all, in my case, I added "https://" before all "www" and it works:)For example: https://www.google.com/For Android developers, this application is also an open source project for educational uses. For source code and tutorials to make WiFi ad-hoc P2P applications, visit our blog at http://www.diyphonegadgets.com or download our blog application:http://goo.gl/x942b

reviews.title: Works perfectly - Galaxy Nexus
reviews.comment: I have a Samsung Galaxy Nexus and with this app I can connect my Nexus 7 tablets (2) and secure the connection with WPA2 security anywhere (which is usually when it gets used by my gf when we\'re on the road) and it works flawlessly every time (so far). Running Jelly Bean 4.2.2 on the phone and the tablets.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.comment: The free version of the app seems to work fine, so I shelled out a fiver to get the PRO version with WPA security. Does it work? for about 20 seconds, yes. Both WPA and WPA2 security settings made the app slow down to a grinding stop, and by setting it back to \'Open\' solved the problem straight away. (Samsung Galaxy Note I)
reviews.author: Stephen Hollands

reviews.title: Reports to cell companies
reviews.comment: I just got a call from att saying that they were notified by a tethering app that I was tethering and threatened to up my charges unless I stopped.   I want my ten bucks back.
reviews.author: Reverend William Henry

reviews.title: No security on pro version.
reviews.comment: Upgraded to Pro version to enable security. Unable to secure,  works great with no security. Very disappointed paying for this app and it doesn\'t eork as advertised.
reviews.author: jim whynot

reviews.title: Great App... a bit pricy!!
reviews.comment: Great App. Got it so I could tether my iPad to my note 2. Works great!! If you\'re w/ Verizon defer the update if you want to wifi tether.
reviews.author: Patrick Burnside

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: Samsung galaxy SIII WORKS LIKE A CHAMP. THANKS
reviews.author: curtis bloodworth

reviews.title: Galaxy S4 Active
reviews.comment: The 1-Click Tether Pro is well worth it.  I was able to share data with my old iPhone while using Waze GPS.   The trip was almost an hour and 1-click maitained the connection reliably.   It was a bit tricky to setup the first time but everything works as described.
reviews.author: Erwin Gumapac

reviews.title: Rob Gilbertson
reviews.comment: The app works just fine but I cannot find a way to prevent anyone that wants to from connecting when it is running.  I paid for the pro version for security and it came with no security.  Disappointing!
reviews.author: Robert Gilbertson

reviews.title: Super easy for most part
reviews.comment: Wish I could figure out how to set password.
reviews.author: Presley Cornette

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: I pay for data, I should be able to use it how I want without getting charged extra for it. The tethering plans are a tremendous ripoff. Thank you for a great app that also respects my battery.
reviews.author: Patrick O\'Donnell

reviews.title: Not working anymore
reviews.comment: I updated the software on my s4 and not it won\'t work. Please fix
reviews.author: Kaimana Chow

reviews.title: Latest Verizon Update
reviews.comment: After upgrading my S4 to the latest Verizon software 1-click no longer works.
reviews.author: Gary M

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Awsome
reviews.author: Randy Pasillas

reviews.title: Perfect.
reviews.comment: Perfect
reviews.author: Mr.S Best

reviews.title: Works and works
reviews.comment: It works pretty well. I like it
reviews.author: G.O. Laun

reviews.comment: Works great on my S4 on AT&T prepaid with rooted phone
reviews.author: james elmore

reviews.title: Working As Designed
reviews.comment: I have a Galaxy Note 2 (AT&T), fired this up and it worked without any issues to tether my Nexus 10.  My wife also tested the tethering with her Galaxy S4, and again, no issues.  Great app!  Hopefully it\'ll stay that way! :)
reviews.author: Greg Cardall

reviews.title: I love this app!
reviews.comment: I love that wherever I go I can link any of my wifi capable devices to my own hotspot and don\'t have to worry about linking onto unsecured networks :-)
reviews.author: Ni\303\261a De Oto\303\261o

reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.comment: It used to work,  now it\'s useless.  Want a refund.
reviews.author: Valerie Jeanne

reviews.title: A bit costly, but never fails
reviews.comment: This is a great app, if a bit $$. If your phone works with FoxFi, that is cheaper, but not updated to keep up with new Android versions like this one is.
reviews.author: Roger Shelton
